result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy S Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees.  $200 DNA surcharge assessed.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.

Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may not have any alcohol in or on the premises of home.  Defendant may not go into any establishments that sell alcohol except for restaurants and grocery stores.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.    Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including an AODA assessment. Take all medications as prescribed by a treating physician. No contact with the victim business Jimmy Johns or the employees. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Per RASO - mandatory jail time has been served
Civil judgment to be entered against defendant for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.
DOC-Notice of Case Status change - revoked - sentenced to co. jail.
Status conference on May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeremy S Smith in court with attorney Joshua Hargrove.  Defendant Jeremy S Smith in custody.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
BTC: Matter adjourned for this case to be set with new case 15CM731.
  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on April 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 19, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.    Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Jeremy S Smith in court with attorney Joshua Hargrove.  Defendant Jeremy S Smith in custody.  Noah Michael Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
